title: Neil: Who is William James? - Quora

response.answer_text: William James is an American psychologist and philosopher from the 19th -20th centuries, best known for developing the philosophy of Pragmatism. He taught at Harvard and collaborated with Charles Peirce, Oliver Wendell Holmes, and Chauncey Wright on many projects, including the development of the Metaphysical Club. Among his students at Harvard were: Boris Sidis, Theodore Roosevelt, George Santayana, W. E. B. Du Bois, G. Stanley Hall, Ralph Barton Perry, Gertrude Stein, Horace Kallen, Morris Raphael Cohen, Walter Lippmann, Alain Locke, C. I. Lewis, and Mary Whiton Calkins. His major works include: The Principles of Psychology (1890),The Will to Believe, and Other Essays in Popular Philosophy (1897)The Varieties of Religious Experience: A Study in Human Nature (1902), ISBNPragmatism: A New Name for Some Old Ways of Thinking (1907), Hackett Publishing 1981:A Pluralistic Universe (1909), Hibbert Lectures, University of Nebraska Press 1996:

Which William James? There was an American philosopher by that name who lived a hundred years ago or so. If he is the one, you can google him to find more information. If you are thinking of some other William James, I don't know. But Google might know.
